track.name: All The World Is Green
comments: Listening and staring out the window as the storm brews outside
makes my heart hurt [2]
just beautiful
magic
wonderful
Beautiful. It's like he's singing a duet with the clarinet. ;_;
I love the mood in this one. Perfect for rainy days.

i fell into the ocean.
my all-time favorite song.
One of the most beautiful songs I've ever heard... [2]
One of the most beautiful songs I've ever heard...
Piękne...

The face forgives the mirror The worm forgives the plow The questions begs the answer Can you forgive me somehow...It's  very poetic and unique metaphor... 

This track is my all time favourite and really touching. So hurtful inside when it comes to the line...Maybe when our story's over. We'll go where it's always spring...
Now this is a love song.
@phaeton: shit-- what was i going to say!?.... oh, i guess that i /have/ repeated it, over, and over, and over, and in-between other Waits, and.... you get the idea...

he speaks to "Marie" in this tune, no? i am impressed by this having, seconds previous-to tagging it "Adria Marie V_____" [beloved, then, now, always-- however no longer connected] , and never having noticed it directly before, i found this coincidence to be, at least, amusing. i'm sure there are better; many more words; paragraphs i could write about the relationship; why i would tag it as such. etc... dig. love the Tom Waits, as you will notice, if you view the profile. i'm amazed at the weighted balance even. [though, i now why-- i've played a lot of Waits during the days of kicking, which have been multiple periods, unfortunately]
This is one of the greatest songs I've ever heard.
Pretend that you owe me nothing.
It can be overwhelming to think about just how casually brilliant this man and his music are.

I came here to jot a note about how beautiful this track is but clearly have been beaten to it. Glad to read others like it as much as I do. 

It's one of the very few tracks I'll repeat over and over. I'd love to hear it live.
